skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.
They can see the Winds of Magic's ebb and flow, enabling them to make the best use of the magical power available.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Fabric woven and tainted with primordial awareness protects while leaving the wearer light on their feet.
There is no knowing what ancient powers sleep in the in the under the water. To most, that is.
Knowledge of trails forgotten by the more civilized races eons ago allow the Balefiend to safely lead the army through the most dangerous of terrain.

effects.description: Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -40% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -60% casualties suffered from all attrition

skillTree.localised_description: Few in Fimir society study outside of their caste, but this one has honed their martial prowess with a Fimm relative.
Mist follows the Balefiend everywhere, obfuscating his movements.
Sometimes it's possible to bend time.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Only few casters are able to stabilize winds of magic.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: In times long since passed, the Fimir were the chosen of the Dark Gods. Perhaps, one day again...soon.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +2
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +4
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8

skillTree.localised_description: Decades spent gathering power in the Chaos Wastes has led to a certain affinity for the more savage of the region.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +10% when increasing
	(own armies in province)

Upkeep: -4% for Fimir, Trolls, Frost Wyrm and Feral Manticore units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Melkoth's Mystifying Miasma Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast, this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: A spectral pendulum is summoned by the Wizard. On command, it swings, razor sharp and with lethal speed, through the foe.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Penumbral Pendulum"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Penumbral Pendulum Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +1 per turn
	(all units in army)
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster opens a vortex leading into the Pit. Anything caught within it will be lost forever.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Pit of Shades Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There's no keeping this one from the battlefield for long.
My lord, I believe Iâ€™ve found something of interest...

effects.description:
Magic item drop chance: +5%
	(own characters in region)

Magic item drop chance: +10%
	(own characters in region)

Magic item drop chance: +20%
	(own characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: We all must fight, no matter our station.
Iâ€™ve managed to procure some additional supplies for the troops, my lord.

effects.description:
Attrition: -3% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(own armies in region)

Attrition: -7% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(own armies in region)

Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: We will not allow them to take our homes, our lands!
We will establish triage and treatment centers as soon as we make camp, my lord.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(own armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The caster weaves a confounding fog that numbs and deludes enemies, causing them to stumble and stagger.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +20%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

effects.description:
Experience gain: +5% for units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

Ambush defence chance: +10%
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Why forlorn? Are you not a king, an emperor â€“ a champion?"

effects.description: Hero self-defence: -10% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A calming presence can be a steadying handâ€¦ but also disquieting.
An assured air instils great confidence in your followers.
Such an ugly scar is always memorable.
Clearly a veteran of some heroic deed.
Skulk and sneak or shadow and stalk, theirs is a guileful nature.
Shares the intellect of a River Troll.
Others may call it decisive, but being uncompromising can be a weakness as well as a strength.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Oh, horrific wonder! Vile awe! Such hateful majesty!
I feel daemonic power within me!
Give own power to others... Not very wise.
Spawns gather around him and hear his commands.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for Fimir Warrior units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Trolls are highly honoured in the eyes of the Changer of the Ways, for rarely does any creature combine mutation with such size, power, and sheer vitality.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Norscan Trolls & Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Physically powerful, armed and armoured with both steel and sorcery, filled with evil intent. Are they even Human?

effects.description:
Upkeep: -4% for Marauder units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Chaos Giants are instinctively drawn to those who bear the favour of the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Norscan Giant units
	(all units in army)

Melee defence: +4 for Norscan Giant units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The blood of our enemies lies here...
Chosen wont serve this little worm, step aside!
The Chaos Gods look on us and smile, there is only war!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Skin Wolves, Norscan Trolls, and Norscan Ice Trolls units
	(all units in army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Forsaken by the Gods, now, they fight only out of a dark, unnatural hunger and madness.
